DeconHelper¶

class DeconHelper.DeconHelper¶

Bases: object

The purpose of this class is to assist in running the deconvolution method obtained through a MatLab project. A lot of the comments in this file are not in English due to the original program containing them.

run_process(input_data, m=3, max_iter=1500, limit=1e-06, label=None, min_val=None, max_val=None, use_pdf=True, show_plots=False, save_plots=False, save_dir='', cluster_iter=0, cluster_name='')¶
Parameters

  • input_data – The input data the deconvolution algorithm is being performed on

  • m – The number of normal curves to use

  • max_iter – The max number of iterations to perform

  • limit – The limit used for precision

  • label – The label associated with the data’s plots

  • min_val – The min value in the input data to use

  • max_val – The max value in the input data to use

  • use_pdf – Whether to use the pdf model or the cdf model, true to use pdf true by default

  • show_plots – A boolean of whether to save the plots or not

  • save_plots – A boolean of whether to save the plots or not

  • save_dir – The directory to save the plots to

  • cluster_iter – The iteration of the current clustering configuration

  • cluster_name – The name of the current clustering configuration

Returns

Nothing

Performs the deconvolution algorithm on the given parameters. Was translated over from a MatLab project.

run_process_on_file(file_path, is_csv, excel_format, m=3, max_iter=1500, limit=1e-06, col='Hardness', min_val=None, max_val=None)¶
Parameters

  • file_path – The path to the file being read

  • is_csv – Whether or not it is a csv file

  • excel_format – The number associated with the format of the excel file

  • m – The number of normal curves to use

  • max_iter – The max number of iterations to perform

  • limit – The limit used for precision

  • col – The label associated with the data’s plots

  • min_val – The min value in the input data to use

  • max_val – The max value in the input data to use

Runs the deconvolution method on a file, not requiring the user to gather the input data themselves.

Returns

Nothing

run_process_on_file_both_sets(file_path, excel_format, m1=3, m2=3, max_iter=1500, limit=1e-06)¶
Parameters

  • file_path – The path to the file being read

  • excel_format – The number associated with the format of the excel file

  • m1 – The number of normal curves to use for the hardness vals

  • m2 – The number of normal curves to use for the modulus vals

  • max_iter – The max number of iterations to perform

  • limit – The limit used for precision

Returns

Nothing

Runs the deconvolution process on an excel file. It runs the process on both the hardness and modulus columns.

DeconHelper.normpdf(x, mean, sd)¶
Parameters

  • x – Value being checked

  • mean – Mean of the normal curve

  • sd – The standard deviation of the curve

Returns

The score of x

Used to determine the score of a value in reference to a normal curve.
